util package¶

Submodules¶

util.config module¶

class util.config.Config(parent=None)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QSettings

QSettings subclass that allows to conveniently access/write settings.

util.exceptionhook module¶

This module allows the installation of an exception hook, which will catch any unexpected exception and log it to the root logger. Additionally it can display a QMessageBox and shut down the application, so users don’t continue using a broken application

util.exceptionhook.handleException(exceptionType, exceptionValue, exceptionTraceback)¶

Handles an exception logging it to the root logger. Arguments are equal to sys.excepthook()

util.exceptionhook.handleExceptionQt(exceptionType, exceptionValue, exceptionTraceback)¶

Handles an exception by first logging it and then showing a QMessageBox with an error message. The QApplication is then exited. Arguments are equal to sys.excepthool()

util.exceptionhook.install()¶

util.filters module¶

class util.filters.FilterDefinition(name)¶

Bases: object

setExpression(key, op, value)¶
util.filters.getFiltersFor(which)¶

util.path module¶

util.path.listfiles(path, ext=None)¶

util.requirements module¶

util.requirements.fulfilled()¶

util.user module¶

Basic RBAC implementation. The User and Role can be used with any backend (file storage, database)

class util.user.Role(name, actions)¶

Bases: object

Class representing a role with permission object like Actions assignable.

class util.user.User(name)¶

Bases: object

Class representing a user. Provides an interface to assign roles to a user and query the permissions granted to that Role.

allowedActions()¶

Returns a list of all Action IDs included in any role the user was assigned to.

util.user.currentUser()¶

Returns the currently logged in User.

util.user.loginUser(name)¶

Logs in a user with a specific user. :param name: user name :type name: str
